And making it resizable like this:

item.title: Help fullscreen
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

No, it works for any client, as long as you know what you are doing. I just, well almost, finished my client for full screen. I started out with a 317 deob. I have like 30-40 screen shots of my progress.

Latest pic:

^ Still need to work on the map icons and the chat back history.

30-40 pics of progress:

Still want some more stuff to be done, then I’ll be working on my server for a while.

@Continue wrote:

Then you have a non-refactored client. The codes I gave you are refactored. Download what I told you to download and use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Help fullscreen
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

Go into RSFrame.java and search for this:

resize

Change everything on that line to this:

Dimension screenSize = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getScreenSize(); resize(screenSize.width, screenSize.height);

Go into client.java and search for this:

public class client extends RSApplet {

Under that line, add this:

public static Dimension screenSize = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getScreenSize(); public static int gframeW = screenSize.width; public static int gframeH = screenSize.height;

Find this:

private void drawInvBack() { aRSImageProducer_1163.initDrawingArea(); Texture.anIntArray1472 = anIntArray1181; invBack.drawSprite(1075, 710); if(invOverlayInterfaceID == -1) { drawSideIcons(); drawRedStones(); } if(invOverlayInterfaceID != -1) drawInterface(0, 1076, RSInterface.interfaceCache[invOverlayInterfaceID], 714); else if(tabInterfaceIDs[tabID] != -1) drawInterface(0, 1076, RSInterface.interfaceCache[tabInterfaceIDs[tabID]], 714); if(menuOpen && menuScreenArea == 1) drawMenu(); aRSImageProducer_1163.drawGraphics(168, super.graphics, 519); aRSImageProducer_1165.initDrawingArea(); Texture.anIntArray1472 = anIntArray1182; }

Change it to this:

private void drawInvBack() { //aRSImageProducer_1163.initDrawingArea(); Texture.anIntArray1472 = anIntArray1181; /* Draws new inventory sprite */ invBack.drawSprite(1075, 710); if(invOverlayInterfaceID == -1) { //drawStatIcons(); } if(invOverlayInterfaceID != -1) drawInterface(0, 1076, RSInterface.interfaceCache[invOverlayInterfaceID], 714); else if(tabInterfaceIDs[tabID] != -1) drawInterface(0, 1076, RSInterface.interfaceCache[tabInterfaceIDs[tabID]], 714); if(menuOpen && menuScreenArea == 1) drawMenu(); //aRSImageProducer_1163.drawGraphics(168, super.graphics, 519); aRSImageProducer_1165.initDrawingArea(); Texture.anIntArray1472 = anIntArray1182; }

Find this:

aRSImageProducer_1165 = new RSImageProducer(512, 334, getGameComponent());

Change it to this:

aRSImageProducer_1165 = new RSImageProducer(gframeW, gframeH, getGameComponent());

Find this:

WorldController.method310(500, 800, 512, 334, ai);

Change it to this:

WorldController.method310(500, 800, gframeW, gframeH, ai);

Find this:

private void drawGameScreen() { if(welcomeScreenRaised) { welcomeScreenRaised = false; frame.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 0); needDrawTabArea = true; inputTaken = true; tabAreaAltered = true; aBoolean1233 = true; if(loadingStage != 2) { aRSImageProducer_1165.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 0); aRSImageProducer_1164.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 700); } } if(loadingStage == 2) method146(); if(menuOpen && menuScreenArea == 1) needDrawTabArea = true; if(invOverlayInterfaceID != -1) { boolean flag1 = method119(anInt945, invOverlayInterfaceID); if(flag1) needDrawTabArea = true; } if(atInventoryInterfaceType == 2) needDrawTabArea = true; if(activeInterfaceType == 2) needDrawTabArea = true; if(needDrawTabArea) { drawTabArea(); needDrawTabArea = false; } if(backDialogID == -1) { aClass9_1059.scrollPosition = anInt1211 - anInt1089 - 110; if(super.mouseX > 478 && super.mouseX < 580 && super.mouseY > 342) method65(494, 110, super.mouseX - 0, super.mouseY - 348, aClass9_1059, 0, false, anInt1211); int i = anInt1211 - 110 - aClass9_1059.scrollPosition; if(i < 0) i = 0; if(i > anInt1211 - 110) i = anInt1211 - 110; if(anInt1089 != i) { anInt1089 = i; inputTaken = true; } } if(backDialogID != -1) { boolean flag2 = method119(anInt945, backDialogID); if(flag2) inputTaken = true; } if(atInventoryInterfaceType == 3) inputTaken = true; if(activeInterfaceType == 3) inputTaken = true; if(aString844 != null) inputTaken = true; if(menuOpen && menuScreenArea == 2) inputTaken = true; if(inputTaken) { drawChatArea(); inputTaken = false; } if(loadingStage == 2) { drawMinimap(); aRSImageProducer_1164.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 519); } if(anInt1054 != -1) tabAreaAltered = true; if(tabAreaAltered) { if(anInt1054 != -1 && anInt1054 == tabID) { anInt1054 = -1; stream.createFrame(120); stream.writeWordBigEndian(tabID); } tabAreaAltered = false; aRSImageProducer_1125.initDrawingArea(); aRSImageProducer_1165.initDrawingArea(); } anInt945 = 0; }

Change it to this:

private void drawGameScreen() { if(welcomeScreenRaised) { welcomeScreenRaised = false; //frame.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 0); needDrawTabArea = true; inputTaken = true; tabAreaAltered = true; aBoolean1233 = true; if(loadingStage != 2) { aRSImageProducer_1165.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 0); aRSImageProducer_1164.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 700); } } if(loadingStage == 2) method146(); if(menuOpen && menuScreenArea == 1) needDrawTabArea = true; if(invOverlayInterfaceID != -1) { boolean flag1 = method119(anInt945, invOverlayInterfaceID); if(flag1) needDrawTabArea = true; } if(atInventoryInterfaceType == 2) needDrawTabArea = true; if(activeInterfaceType == 2) needDrawTabArea = true; if(needDrawTabArea) { //drawTabArea(); needDrawTabArea = false; } if(backDialogID == -1) { aClass9_1059.scrollPosition = anInt1211 - anInt1089 - 110; if(super.mouseX > 478 && super.mouseX < 580 && super.mouseY > 342) method65(494, 110, super.mouseX - 0, super.mouseY - 348, aClass9_1059, 0, false, anInt1211); int i = anInt1211 - 110 - aClass9_1059.scrollPosition; if(i < 0) i = 0; if(i > anInt1211 - 110) i = anInt1211 - 110; if(anInt1089 != i) { anInt1089 = i; inputTaken = true; } } if(backDialogID != -1) { boolean flag2 = method119(anInt945, backDialogID); if(flag2) inputTaken = true; } if(atInventoryInterfaceType == 3) inputTaken = true; if(activeInterfaceType == 3) inputTaken = true; if(aString844 != null) inputTaken = true; if(menuOpen && menuScreenArea == 2) inputTaken = true; if(inputTaken) { //drawChatArea(); inputTaken = false; } if(loadingStage == 2) { //drawMinimap(); //aRSImageProducer_1164.drawGraphics(0, super.graphics, 519); } if(anInt1054 != -1) tabAreaAltered = true; if(tabAreaAltered) { if(anInt1054 != -1 && anInt1054 == tabID) { anInt1054 = -1; stream.createFrame(120); stream.writeWordBigEndian(tabID); } tabAreaAltered = false; aRSImageProducer_1125.initDrawingArea(); aRSImageProducer_1165.initDrawingArea(); } anInt945 = 0; }

Find this:

private void drawMinimap() {

Just in that method, comment out this:

aRSImageProducer_1164.initDrawingArea();

Find this:

private void drawChatArea() {

Comment out this:

aRSImageProducer_1166.initDrawingArea();
aRSImageProducer_1166.drawGraphics(338, super.graphics, 0);

Now, under this:

drawHeadIcon();

Add this right under it:

drawInvBack(); drawMinimap(); drawChatArea();

If you get any errors, post them here. Also, this little tutorial I made is for refactored clients only. If you have a non-refactored client, may I suggest using this:

http://uppit.com/v/1QTUC2Q0

Download it. It’s used for refactored and non-refactored clients. If I have a code in there, say this little method:

private void drawChatArea() {

Search for this in the text document you downloaded:

chatarea

Then it’ll come up like this:

public void method18(int) 	=>	drawChatArea

If it doesn’t, keep searching. Do that for each one. If it says, drawMinimap, search for “minimap”. Also, if you have a non-refactored client, use method18. Refactored clients use drawChatArea and all the other renamed methods. Hope this helped.

Read full topic
